channel.title: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade

item.title: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Try

return true;

I’m not really sure, I would suggest trying out a devolution server, because it’s alot more stable that regular servers(Czar, or any form of that sort) Unless you make it stable.

Devolution would probably be a good choice of source.

item.title: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade
item.dc:creator: @Bubbsy7 Bubbsy7
item.description:
@Bubbsy7 wrote:

It says i’m missing a return value when i add:

if(playerRights == 2){ sendMessage("Trading has been disabled for Administrators, to prevent corruption."); return; }

item.source: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade

item.title: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

One second, let me look at my source, I’ll help.

Try searching for

public boolean tradeItem

You might not have it, I’m using a Devolution 7.8 base, so I’m not sure.

And you add

if(playerRights == 2){ sendMessage("Trading has been disabled for Administrators, to prevent corruption."); return; }

and

if(other.playerRights == 2){ sendMessage("You can't trade with Administrators."); return; }

Change the playerRights, or whatever you have to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a compiler error when trying to make admins not being able to trade
item.dc:creator: @Bubbsy7 Bubbsy7
item.description:
@Bubbsy7 wrote:

Ok I add this in my case 128 (trading case)

case 128: //Trade Request if(other.playerRights == 2){ sendMessage("Admins cannot trade."); return; } if(playerRights == 2){ sendMessage("Admins cannot trade."); return; } WanneTradeWith = inStream.readUnsignedWord(); WanneTrade = 1; break;
I get a problem with the if(other.playeRights) part…PLEASE HELP!
